image.caption: Collection of the U.S. House of Representatives About this object

profileText: A Representative from Michigan; born in Pittsford, Monroe County, N.Y., May 20, 1843; attended the public schools in Pittsford and Rochester; moved to Plainwell, Mich., in 1869 and engaged in the lumber business in Allegan and Kalamazoo Counties; moved to West Bay City in 1881 and established a sawmill and box factory; member of the board of aldermen 1889-1892; mayor of West Bay City 1893-1895; member of the State house of representatives 1895-1901; elected as a Republican to the Fifty-fourth and to the three succeeding Congresses and served from March 4, 1895, until his death in West Bay City, Mich., May 1, 1901; chairman, Committee on Mines and Mining (Fifty-sixth Congress); interment in Elm Lawn Cemetery, Bay City, Bay County, Mich.

creativeWork.freeFormCitationText: United States. 57th Congress, 2d session, 1902-1903. Memorial addresses on the life and character of Rousseau O. Crump (late a Representative from Michigan), delivered in the House of Representatives and Senate, Fifty-seventh Congress. Washington: Government Printing Office, 1903.
